result.execSummary:
The defendant Leroy J Knight Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and fees. To be paid by September 12, 2016 or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges pursuant to 303.08 Wis. stats for  work only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leroy J Knight Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 38 (thirty-eight) days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for work ONLY:

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by September 12, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Leroy J Knight in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Leroy J Knight in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Leroy J Knight not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record, Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court ordered all other conditions remain the same. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
On Court's own motion cash bail amended to $1000. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leroy J Knight in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Leroy J Knight in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program Discharge Summary report dated June 15, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered NO bail posted to be forfeited at this time.

15RM027622  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/02/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Deshon O. or Sentry Foods

Defendant Leroy J Knight in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Leroy J Knight in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
